titles.title: To authorize the Secretary of the Interior to take certain Federal lands located in El Dorado County, California, into trust for the benefit of the Shingle Springs Band of Miwok Indians, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation.
Referred to the Subcommittee Indian and Alaska Native Affairs.
Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation Discharged.
Subcommittee Indian and Alaska Native Affairs Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 113-195.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 142.

bill.summary: 9/10/2013--Reported to House amended. Takes specified federal land in El Dorado County, California, into trust for the Shingle Springs Band of Miwok Indians. Describes that land as the approximately 40.852 acres of federal land under the administrative jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management (BLM) identified as "Conveyance boundary" on the map titled "Shingle Springs Land Conveyance/Draft" and dated June 7, 2012, including improvements and appurtenances thereto. Prohibits class II and III gaming on such lands.
